page.title: 09HOUSING IN BOWBURN.
page.content: HOUSING IN BOWBURN CAN BE CLASSIFIED BY AGE AND OWNERSHIP.THE COLLIERY HOUSES ADD UP TO ONE HUNDRED AND SIXTY THREE.LAMBS PLACE AND SLATER PLACE WERE BUILT SINCE THE MAP.SURTEES AVENUE HAS EIGHTY ONE HOUSES,NOT INCLUDING THE TWO SCHOOLS.CAMBRIDGE TERRACE HAS FIFTEEN HOUSES AND OXFORD TERRACE HAS TWELVE.LAMBS PLACE WHICH IS ON THE LEFT HAND SIDE OF THE A177 HAS TWELVE HOUSES TOO.THE HALLGARTH ESTATE HAS ONE HUNDRED AND SIX HABITATIONS WHEREAS THE BROADMEADOWS ESTATE HAS ONLY THIRTY FIVE.LANDSDOWN CRESCENT HAS TWENTY TWO HOUSES AND GRANGE PARK HAS TWENTY FOUR.IN CASTLE STREET THERE ARE SEVEN HOUSES AND IN ST.JOHN'S CRESCENT THERE ARE SIX.IN BOTH NORTON AND NEWBURN AVENUES ALTOGETHER THERE ARE FIFTY SIX HOUSES. IN BOW STREET THERE ARE TWENTY NINE HOUSES.BURN STREET HAS TWENTY SIX.THE
